Greetings & Salutations!
Thank you for visiting our campaign! If you are here, you may have a love for great grandma Gloria's mahogany coffee table and a fierce hatred for condensation. Maybe your constant ceramic coffee cup companion calls for a custom coaster. Perhaps, your affection for fine furniture frustrates you for lack of matching accessories. Whatever your need, we assume you are here to solve a problem and we have just the solution for you!
Everybody needs a coaster!
Want to add a handsome accessory to your drink-ware? Looking to protect your heirloom furniture? Want a personalized piece of art in your dining room? Our simple, elegant, and customizable coasters crafted from verified sustainable or reclaimed hardwoods will be an eye-catching addition to your table or bar.
These hardwood coasters are available in 3 shapes and 4 wood varieties, each measuring 4" across and 1/4" thick. Choose from circle, rounded square, and curved square (see image below for exact shapes). Finished with multiple coats of acrylic lacquer for a great shine, long life, and water resistance.
About Our Wood
One of the core principles at our woodshop has always been to use reclaimed, salvaged, and sustainable wood sources. The Walnut, Maple, and Cherry woods used in our coasters are harvested as part of Appalachian Hardwood Verified Sustainable program. Click on the image below to find out more!
The "Blue Pine" wood that is used for our coasters is actually from a tree called the Lodgepole Pine. These trees have been killed by beetles carrying a fungus that changes the color of the wood. These trees are removed from the forest floor and milled into lumber to prevent risk of injury and forest fires. To learn more about the Pine Beetle Epidemic, head over to National Geographic.
Coaster Wood Choices
Coaster Shape Choices
We are currently offering 3 basic shapes for our coasters. We may add a few more options as stretch goals, but the 3 starter shapes are below:
Monogram Options
For the custom engraved coaster rewards, a monogram is included. Monograms come in two varieties. A single letter monogram usually represents a family name. A 3 letter monogram can represent a person's initials or two individuals' first name initials and their last name initial in the middle. You can select from one of the 3 styles below for your monogram:
Rewards
Add-ons
In addition to a coaster reward, you can add on the following items by increasing your pledge the appropriate amount:
$5 - Whidden's Woodshop Tote Bag
$8 - Resuable Alder Wood Thank You Card
$10 Reward: Alder Wood Thank You Card
Why Kickstarter?
Whidden's Woodshop is currently our young family's primary income. We have been running our small family business for almost a year at this point. We currently have Etsy shop and sell items locally at craft fairs and art shows, but that isn't enough to provide for our growing family of 6 (and 2 cats).
Kickstarter allows for global exposure and creates permanent relationships with people who are passionate about what we create and also with potential retail buyers.
Our goal for this campaign is to raise enough funds to fulfill all our rewards, purchase additional equipment for our shop, and to provide for monthly expenses for our family.

campaign.story:
A 3 Meter Extra-Long, Tangle-Free, Charging Cable
When we began designing our charging cable, we realized that there were other, similar (yet less reliable) products on the market, but they contained a few critical flaws to their design:
● Too short! There is nothing worse than trying to charge your phone at one outlet, but realizing that the nearest flat surface, or where you were planning to store your phone, is on the other side of the room! This is never a problem with our strong cable.
● Tangles = Breakage For those of us who have used charging cables, we know that tangles aren’t only unsightly, but a tangle left to its own devices can cause breakage along the length or end of the cable. Eventually, it causes the cable to rip or break altogether. Not only does our unique cover protect the cable from breakage, but it also prevents tangles outright with a nylon fabric casing.
● Cheaply Made Products Don’t Last Sure, you could buy a dollar-store charging cable as a last resort, but how long will that last? Cheaply made charging cables are notorious for breaking, not holding the charge, or even completely falling out of the device mid-charge. Why risk your expensive device with a cable that could possible break your phone? Our product contains quality materials produced by careful craftsmanship by a small, independent company. 
Impact:  The Strong Cable features incredible innovation, and vastly improves upon the average charging cable. We have built solid relationships with our suppliers, and we have already thoroughly vetted their supplies and our resulting products. We have a strong foundation for this product, but we need your support to help us get there! 
What We Need & What You Get: We are seeking the support of the community to help us meet our 400 item MOQ (Minimum Order Quantity). By donating to our campaign, you are helping us reach our goals and push towards wide distribution of our product, marketing the Strong Cable, and much more. 
Additional funding will be used towards the costs related to rewards, furthering our campaign and more! To thank our generous backers, we are offering numerous exciting rewards at a variety of donation levels. Please view the rewards on the right-hand side of the page and select the reward that works for you!
Other Ways You Can Help: If you can’t make a donation at this time, there are still other ways you can help us reach our goals! Please take a moment to share our campaign with your friends and family via social media, email, and word of mouth. With your support, we can reach our funding goals and meet our minimum order quantity requirements!

The Strong Cable will be sent to Apple to receive MFI certification. This will allow us to use the "Made for iPhone/iPod/iPad" logo on our product. MFI certified accessories use certified Apple connectors purchased directly from Apple. This means that you will receive a higher quality product. We have built solid relationships with our suppliers who have experience producing MFI certified products. We have built our company on the belief that we are only as good as the quality of our products. We live this principles in every aspect of our business. campaign.story:
STELLIGHT
We wanted to design bike lights because WE ARE BIKERS.
Intrigued by the speed of cycling and freed from worries brought by bike lights, we, however, were somehow frustrated by the stereotyping of bike lights. Traditional bike lights have a limited choice of light patterns for various purposes while riding and suiting our taste. Bikers’ control over the lights, especially the rear one, is not convenient either.
Aspired to work for the good of bikers, Grabo targeted at designing biker-friendly, personalized and customizable bike lights which at the same time make use of our QR code sharing system (Patent Pending) to make the whole light more helpful and enjoyable.
Putting our creativity into practice, we proudly present to you the new generation of bike lights – STELLIGHT.
Stellight - "THE FRONT"
Stellight - "THE REAR"
The metal housing makes STELLIGHT strong, durable and fashionable.
Check out on the different colors to match you bike and suit your taste.
Standard Color - Silver Grey
Special Color - Blue
Special Color - Orange
Special Color - Red
Special Color - Black
The prerequisite of bike light is safety for bikers. STELLIGHT has the brightness of 360 lumen (“THE FRONT”) for you to be seen clearly on the road. Enjoy carefree riding. 
As bikers, we understand it is annoying to adjust the rear light while cycling, because it isn’t convenient and does not look cool. STELLIGHT is designed to be biker-friendly. Simply rotate the FRONT KNOB to turn on and/or alter the light pattern of the “THE REAR”, without fetching your arm backwards.
Control “THE REAR” with the FRONT KNOB
Match your Bike, Match your Mood. Every little part of your bike is a reflection of your personality and deserves to be noticed. With STELLIGHT, biking will be more than enjoyable when you can show your mood and personality through self-defined light patterns. Different light patterns also go for different purposes, say high frequency alert and energy-saving patterns.
If you’re not satisfied with our six built-in customizable light patterns, why not download from our STELLIGHT WEB?
Up till now 60+ light patterns have been constructed and will be available soon on STELLIGHT WEB! Have a preview of some of them in our promotional video!
Wide range of light patterns
  Not content with the above? Quench your thirst by watching more!
Plus any pattern you can imagine!
The power of creativity lies in the human mind and can never be underestimated. Each of the “THE FRONT” and “THE REAR” consists of six LEDs. You can design the brightness of each LED and interval of flash with the user-friendly STELLIGHT APP, which supports Android and iPhone. The change of brightness for each LED can be up to 50Hz, which is adequate for smooth fade-in and fade-out patterns or high frequency flashing alert patterns.
With your creativity, there can be more than a million possible light patterns. Learn how to:
DIY whatever light pattern of your taste
STELLIGHT APP
Fascinated by your own creation? Share your masterpiece with us on STELLIGHT WEB and enjoy the applause!
To offer you the greatest room for creativity and free you from worries, STELLIGHT APP gives you an estimate of the burn time of your designed light pattern and re-estimates it upon your every tiny change to the pattern. With the help of STELLIGHT and STELLIGHT APP, you can always design the optimal light pattern for your taste and the length of the cycling journey, but never be bothered by inability to estimate the burn time! Happy cycling!
Cycling can be more fun if you do it with friends who enjoy the same interest. If you’re generous, share your light pattern, be it hunt from STELLIGHT WEB or self-designed with your creative mind, by letting your friends scan the QR code and uploading it onto their own STELLIGHT. The sharing of light patterns among various STELLIGHT is done offline WITHOUT connection to the Internet, i.e. anywhere, anytime! The fun will be more than expected!
  The same light pattern can also help you locate your biking friends while riding on the busy road without verbally speak to them.
System Workflow
The housing of STELLIGHT can resist the splash of water and free you from frustration under unstable weather. Rain? Not a problem anymore! Look cool in any ride, anywhere, anytime.
Everyone deserves the right to have fun. STELLIGHT is designed with love and care, and can be mounted and dismounted no matter you are left-handed or right-handed. The FRONT KNOB can be rotated with either hand.
Flexible Mounting - Leaving space for other gadgets
For Left-handers & Right-handers
The magic is, even when STELLIGHT is mounted at different orientations, say upside down for left-handers or right-handers, the set light pattern will remain unchanged in terms of its direction. The rotation direction for the FRONT KNOB for turning on "THE REAR" or altering light patterns is also the same in whatever orientation STELLIGHT is set. We keep everything simple for you! Be worry-free!
Who wants to be upset by running out power? STELLIGHT keeps going with AAA alkaline or rechargeable batteries. Simply grab equivalents in nearby convenience stores and keep going in your cycling journey.
STELLIGHT offers flexibility in terms of number of batteries used:
At least 2 batteries: to maintain optimal performance, for longer rides.
1 battery: for emergency use
To ensure stable brightness of the light, three individual power channels are used and each supplies current to two LEDs. Each power channel has its exclusive power management IC and power circuit.
STELLIGHT adopts the latest BLE technology (Bluetooth Low Energy Connectivity) to maximize the convenience for bikers. The upload of light patterns from smartphone to “THE FRONT” and “THE REAR” is done wirelessly by BLE.
While bikers may like to make everything simple and be carefree while riding, the use of smartphone is NOT a must once light patterns have been uploaded to “THE FRONT” or “THE REAR”. Patterns of “THE FRONT” can be changed by rotating FRONT KNOB, and those of “THE REAR” can be changed also by rotating FRONT KNOB since the two lights are connected wirelessly by BLE. We make everything simple for you!
To design a bike light best for biker’ use, we have poured hours into researching and surveying a large number of bikers. What’s good about the current bike lights? What needs to be improved? What do they look for if they buy a new bike light? If they can be a little bit greedy, what funny points would they like to add to the light?
There have been a lot of changes from the very first design of STELLIGHT.
Initial Designs of STELLIGHT
And here comes the final version.

This App would be suitable for Google Glass as the Utillix App has 3D and augmented views. The Utillix App will be a GPS device for recording and viewing underground infrastructure locations while excavating or installing underground services. In real time, site excavators and utility services can view in 3D what to beneath the ground before beginning work. There will also be a central database to record the new information which will be updated regularly.

The Utillix Site Excavation Mapping Tool is a world first application that is a fusion of technology and functionality.  There is significant danger risk to individuals that excavate without checking for power-lines or pipes.  Owners need to know where safe areas are underground to dig before a job starts and individuals on-site need the visibility of what is underground as they dig.  By using the Site Excavation Mapping Tool excavation is safer, quicker and more accurate thus saving lives, time and money. This site excavation mapping App is bases around real-time visual presentation of the underground infrastructure - a 3D view of what is beneath your feet using GPS technology much like Google Earth. There is currently no update information of the underground services and the Utillix App will provide Augmented location visuals of all the underground services, all at a touch of a button. campaign.story:
Deal With It
   The New Drinking Game For Every Party                    
Deal With It is a highly intoxicating drinking card game. Players take turns drawing cards until the cards or the players hit the deck. The deck is made up of two types of cards that allow  you to deal out forfeits to your friends forcing them to take a drink or carry out a ridiculous action.
The game gets more and more intense with each white card put in play, the different combination of rules work together with the black cards making for fun and twisted gameplay that will keep you on your toes.
So if you’re into drinking, card games and chilling with your friends then we think you will love our game as much as we do!
The Origin Story
In my first year as a university student, I lived in a massive residence hall. I brought with me a lifetime love of board and card games.
Last year, I created a new game called “Twist of Fate” which I developed with my University class mates  board game society.
The feedback we got was astounding. When we first debuted it, people were literally running toward us to ask us about the game and give it a try. Seeing their enthusiasm sparked a passion in me to create games that connect people. 
At the same time, drinking games like Kings was a great way to meet new people. I loved going to different rooms and seeing the different rules everyone played with. 
This got me thinking...
What if you could take all those 'house rules' and put them into one game? There was no way to do it with a conventional deck of cards, because you can’t assign two different rules to one card. I needed to create a new game with its own dedicated cards. I got in contact with Vincent to help me carry this game forward and thus, Deal With It and our little team was born.

The Game 
Deal With It is a drinking card game that takes ideas from your favourite games and puts a twist on them. The deck currently consists of 52 cards (just like a conventional playing card deck) containing two different types of cards.
Black cards are Action cards. These are the standard Kings rules you’re used to (“2 is you,” “3 is me,” etc). In order to come up with the best collection of Actions, we surveyed students at my university and beyond about their favourite "house rules" and compiled a database of rules. The Action cards in Deal With It include such cards as “Mercy,” “Fuck You,” “Categories,” and “Kings Cup.” 
White cards are Active cards. These are permanent rules that affect everyone at the table for as long as the cards are in play. For example, if you play “No D Words,” no one is allowed to use a word that starts with ‘D.’ If you break the rule and the other players catch you, you drink! There is also a special Deal With It! card. If you draw this card, keep it hidden, and when someone tells you to drink, you can play this card and turn the tables, forcing that player to drink for you. They’ll just have to “Deal with it!”
                  We have a finished design, a working prototype, and now we are ready to put Deal With It into mass production. In order to do so, we need help from you to reach the funding goal and to put the first run into production. Funding will also go toward marketing and promotion. By backing this campaign, you will be guaranteed a deck of your own and be one of the first people to begin play testing Deal With It on a wider scale. 

If we exceed the funding goal, we will be able to offer all kinds of fantastic perks to our loyal contributors. We will be able to get to work on creating expansions for the game, and higher tier contributors can get access to limited edition cards, design their own cards for future expansions, or even play test the game with us, the creators! We want to offer as many incentives as possible to those who are able to donate the money we need to make this happen. 


 If you enjoy drinking games or card games like Cards Against Humanity, then Deal With It is perfect for you. Sharing your enthusiasm for Deal With It with your friends is just as valuable as a financial contribution. The more people who get excited about this, the bigger and better the final product will be.

We are committed to creating games that connect people, and I hope you will share this commitment with me. Please take a moment to share this campaign on your social media profiles and get the word out there.

Great stories need to be told…
     This story was originally written for children, to show them that both beauty and pain exist in the world and that life isn’t about embracing one and fearing the other but learning how they inform one another. Growing up is hard, no matter the generation. I wrote Earthking to show young readers that they are not alone in their adolescent trials. The character of Col is based on my younger brothers and though they’re no longer children the lessons remain.
     Stories are what remind us we were made to dream and to do. When we’re young we have the ability to see the world with wimsy and mystery. When we grow up we tend to lose that. Earthking is my attempt to recapture that wonder, to remind readers both young and old to dream and to do.
     Great stories need to be told. Please consider helping me tell mine.
     The funds raised for this project will go toward printing, editing, registration and conversion costs.
Check out the Earthking website for a peek at Chapter 1!
www.earthkingchronicles.com

campaign.story:
~Please share our project with your friends and family~
What we would like to be known as
Self-sustaining small, community welcoming farm, we want to help our community and make them welcome on our farm.
The first question on your mind is likely "How does someone have a farm but need to buy dirt?" The answer is fairly straight forward. We own a farm meaning we have the animals and hay fields and equipment but we don’t own farm land. We rent hay fields in exchange for part of the hay and we rent barns in exchange for livestock feed. What this means basically is that after work we go to the rented barns or rented hay fields and do what needs to be done whether it is making hay or milking goats. We are farmers without a farm, farming none the less.
The name of our farm started out as a joke when we bought 3 goats because we didn’t own a house or farm land. The name really grew on us though and it was a very accurate name so it stuck.
Our Goal
We would like to be a place where the community can come for free to spend some time on a working farm. We want to have school children come learn about animals and plants. We want foster kids to be able to learn that the world can be a wonderful place and new things can be fun and exciting. We want people of all ages to be able to come have moonlit picnics under the stars or come pick apples in the fall and berries in the spring for free. We want to take extra produce and eggs to Detroit and Flint and any other areas that need more access to low cost vegetables and nutritious eggs. We want to offer summer programs for urban youth to come stay on the farm for a few days or weeks so they can learn there is more than just life in a big city. We want to offer classes for butchery, soap making, milking, cheese making, herb growing as well as gardening and maintaining a healthy orchard. We have big dreams, ideas and hopes to make a difference in other people’s lives.
What we have
For this season we have about 60 acres of hay field we will turn into hay bales to feed our animals and pay the landowners, this means we get about 40 acres of baled hay but must do the work to make 60 acres worth including machinery maintenance, gas, oil, and drive time to get to the separate fields.
We have a lot of farm animals for our farm, we put the cart before the horse so to speak. Right now Nein Haus Farms owns the following.
20 Dairy Goats - Alpines, Nubians, Nigerians, LaManchas and Boer
11 Muscovy Ducks - Young Adults
14 Pekin Ducks - Juvenile Ducks about 10 weeks old
13 Rouen Ducks - Juvenile Ducks about 10 weeks old
11 Mixed Breed Rabbits
19 Leghorn Hens
4 Polish Hens with 2 Roosters
3 Mille Fleur D’uccle Bantams
A few Barred Buffs, Barred Rocks, Iowa Blue, bantams and other mixed breed adults.
4 Chinese Ring neck Pheasants
A lot of variously aged chicks (we hatch our own)
And a meal worm farm
What we do
You might be wondering what we do with all these animals? The goats are a dairy herd and get milked daily we are hoping to do herd shares with the goats as they are raised organically but right now we have no place they can come pick up milk and no place for an extra fridge to hold large amounts of milk. Goat kids are sold as pets or 4-h goats. The chickens and ducks lay eggs that we sell; they are organic, non-soy, non-gmo and cage free. There is a large need for farm eggs in our area and even with us selling 7 dozen eggs a week and some of our friends selling 22 dozen eggs a week there is still a 6 week wait or longer to get into the egg rotation which is why we have so many chicks because they will grow up and lay eggs hopefully easing some of the demand and allowing more people access to more nutritious eggs. The rabbits are used for meat rabbits or on occasion pets and 4-h rabbits. We are big fans of re-using things such as pallets, the tin off a old carport, snow fencing, safety fence, crating boards from steel shipments, even nails and screws.
Last year we rented 2 acres of land at two different locations to plant gardens. We had sweet corn, tomatoes, peppers, cucumbers, kohlrabi, cauliflower, broccoli, snap peas, green beans, brussel sprouts, beets, onions, pie pumpkins, field pumpkins, squashes and cabbage.
We are members of the local farmers market. Most think we are underpriced. Really for us it is more important that the community has a place to get affordable produce and eggs then it is to make a large profit. As long as the farm can sustain itself that is all we require
What we need
Hopefully you’re still with me. The reason we started our Kickstarter campaign is because we are farming without a farm and the logistics of doing it costs a lot of money, so much money in fact we cannot save enough money for a down payment on a farm. We have good credit and the bank approved us for a loan but we would need to have more down payment money. At the peak of summer we will be traveling over 100 miles some days just to be able to complete our farm activities. We are hardworking people who just need a little help to try to make a difference in our community.
Our daily routine
A typical day starts with getting up at 6am to go to my full time job, I work 7am to 4pm Monday-Friday. i get home at about 4:30pm, chickens, ducks and rabbits are feed and watered. Then we drive over to our friend Holli's place about 8 miles away to where we keep our goats, goats are watered, hayed, milked, and grained. After that we either go another 8 miles to the garden sites and weed or plant and water the garden, pick vegetables that are ready or we go make hay which involves mowing, raking, drying, baling, or transporting the hay another 6+ miles away to where we rent barn space for hay storage. Then we go home ducklings and chicks get another round of food and water, the meal worm farm gets veggies/fruit and the dogs get fed. Then we candle or set eggs and moves eggs that need to hatch to the hatcher and clean incubators. Then I make human food and clean up the house as best as I can then go to bed at midnight so i can get up at 6am again.  
What you can offer
If we could just get some soil (buy the farm) so everything was in one place we could accomplish so much more. A lot of time and energy is spent in logistics right now that could be put to far better use. If we could place gardens at our own farm we could plant more vegetables, as well as trees and berries. It is not feasible to plant fruit trees and shrubs any place right now because of the long establishment period before they bear fruit. With more vegetables and fruits we could share more good quality food with more disadvantaged people. If we had a central place (the farm) where people knew they could come to get fresh vegetables, fruits, eggs and meat at little or no cost it would make a very big difference. We personally know people who live meal to meal and most of those meals are "cheap" meaning they are processed foods with almost no nutritional value. The number of people only just scraping by in our local communities and the large inner cities weighs heavy on us and reminds us to be happy and thankful with any opportunities that are placed before us. If you can help make a difference to some small and large communities in northern Michigan please pledge.
 Goal #1
Installing a night time blooming garden with "fairy type" lighting. This would be a very unique and fun addition to the moonlit picnics we would be offering.
Goal #2
Purchase and install a High Tunnel to extend our growing season by 4-6 weeks. The Ag office will extend a grant to us so we would only be required to pay 8% of the tunnel cost plus labor cost to erect the tunnel.
Goal #3
CSA shares along with offering handmade organic soap, laundry detergent, and lotions.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Greg's famous quote when everything goes wrong or breaks "We're farming now" As a farmer you learn to take the good and the bad and tomorrow there will be another sunrise and more to do so there is no reason to get to worked up about whatever did or didnt happen as you planned today...it will get done.

The biggest risks on a farm are always animals and the weather. 

We could have a horrid growing season, lack of rainfall can be compensated for by watering plants manually but a spring/summer/fall that are to cold will have a much greater impact on your plants ability to grow and produce. For example last year a field that should have yielded 600+ square bales of hay only gave us about 230 bales because spring was late and summer was not warm enough. This meant we were short on winter hay so we made a deal to clean out someones barn for hay and to haul hay for someone else in exchange for hay.

Heavy animal losses are always bad for any unplanned reason. We had high hopes for our first kidding season a combination of bred does we bought(previous owners bred to early) and a cold winter along with an open barn made for a lot of frostbite scares and bottle babies. we had a few kids die before we got to them due to the cold of winter being born in january and febuary. We also lost a doe we bought who was bred (to young by previous owners) and the twin doe kids she was pregnant with. Losing animals is always a sad upsetting day for any farm, the question becomes how you to stop it from happening again. We keep young does away from the bucks and we do not breed them until later in the year so we miss the coldest months of january and febuary.

campaign.story:
Who Are We?
We’re a group of developers, gamers, hackers - oh yeah, and parents. We started Tynker in order to give our own kids a more engaging introduction to programming. We knew learning how to code would be important for building a career in the twenty-first century - but, while there were several languages and tools to choose from, we found that strings of letters and punctuation on a screen were not an attention-grabbing medium for kids. Our product, Tynker, offers a new way to learn to program. Over 23 million kids have started coding with Tynker, and every day we are inspired by what they do with it! 
PLAY

What is Tynker?
Tynker is an interactive platform where kids solve puzzles while learning how to build web and mobile games, create interactive stories, animations, and music, and share their creations with friends!
Does Tynker Work?
At Tynker, we are constantly striving to find the right balance of fun and learning when we build products for kids. We work with the best game designers, developers, instructional designers, art directors and producers to design high quality educational content, deeper storylines, engaging themes and likable characters. 
Twenty-three million kids (and counting) can’t be wrong - Tynker is a new way to learn. But if that’s not enough to inspire your confidence, we’ve also been given these stamps of approval:
How Does Tynker Work?
Three Coding Adventures - 400 puzzles and games - Endless possibilities
Glitch Manor: Our introductory Adventure guides your character through a haunted manor. Discover hidden secrets and unlock treasure chests with the help of sprites. Play through the ten levels and 50+ fun activities.
Turing’s Tower: Once you’ve gained some basic coding skills in Glitch Manor, traverse a steampunk-styled game world and collect parts to repair a flying castle. Program the tower's exotic abilities, collect crystals with a robotic claw or aim cannons to shoot down flying robots! Play through four worlds and build 16 games. 
Goblin Quest: In our advanced Adventure, travel through a magical realm to defeat the Goblin King. Take on the role of the Hacker and change the way the world works! Kids build their own code to direct armies and program epic battles. Play through four more game worlds and build 16 more games.
With Tynker, kids learn fundamental concepts like events, variables, loops, functions, and principles of computational thinking – the basic building blocks of every programming language. Once proficient, they can seamlessly transition to Javascript coding within the Tynker learning system.
Why Tynker?
Coding, and the computational thinking that it demands, gives kids the skills they need in the digital age. Whether or not they grow up to be computer programmers, kids will be able to understand the basics of how to build computer programs, which is useful for artists, journalists, business owners, and anyone regularly using computers as part of their job (that is, almost everyone!).
Our mission is to ensure that every child has the opportunity to learn to code, especially girls. Currently only 18% of CS jobs are held by women. We don’t want any child to be left behind as the current generation enters today's digital world.
Why This Project?
We want to make sure that every child has the opportunity to learn to code. With your backing, we will continue to provide free coding tools and curriculum to thousands of schools and millions of kids worldwide to get introduced to programming in a fun way.
With the support we get from you in this round of funding, we will be launching our games in June 2015, and hoping to reach millions more kids!
Features!
Program battles, design your own characters and publish apps!
We’ll also be updating our apps on iPad and Android with support for connected devices so kids can use the same visual language to seamlessly command drones, the Hue/Lux light systems, and even robots like Ollie and Sphero. Kids will be able to bring their code to life, and control compatible objects -- creating spectacular light shows, flying drones through the air, and teaching their robots to put on a dance show.
When kids can see the effects of their coding take shape in the physical world, they will be even more inspired by what they’ve learned to do.

campaign.story:
Cassandra has a problem...and it's only the first of many.
Being raised as the youngest child in a family of great heroes would be a challenge for anyone. 
Her great-grandfather is the mighty King of Dragons, Draconis. Her father fought off hordes of monstrous creatures at the Battle of Heatherington Keep and sacrificed everything putting an end to a viscous cult of anti-dragon zealots. Even her mother rose to greatness as one of the rulers of Dragon Keep and a beacon for peace across Amesdia bringing Dragons, Humans, Elves and Dwarves together in an alliance that stood many trials over the last century.
Until a few days ago, Cassandra was content with her role as the child of greatness. She was studious, spent most of her waking hours with her mother and other heads of state and at her fathers insistence, learned how to duel. As her siblings had before her, Cassandra knew she would likely be matched with a partner for political reasons and had long since accepted her role in the world.
That was, of course, before her mother died and before her...transformation. Overnight, her soft pale skin sprouted gorgeous golden dragon scales. 
Presented with a future she no longer recognizes, as the first of her kind, she must overcome a whole new set of challenges if she hopes to survive the unknown threat that comes from across the Careless Sea.

As brothers born on opposite sides of the country, Beck and Oliver ventured to build a brand that shares their unique coastal styles. With Beck having grown up in Southern California and Oliver in New England, they have worked to refine traditional California surfwear, while adding a blend of east coast design. 
Their goal wasn’t just to create another clothing brand. Rather, they set out to leave a lasting impact, to be something that is more than just a label.
Balboa was founded by a generation born into a world that needs fixing. Beck and Oliver’s parents instilled in them an attitude to not take life’s simplest necessities for granted. As they grew up, they learned the value in helping others. Whether it was seeking out homeless in downtown LA or working on organic farms, the two developed an affinity for aiding those in the community that couldn’t afford proper food.
Bringing together their love for clothing and their passion for ending hunger, Balboa was born.
Balboa’s plan is simple. For every product sold, a set number of meals is donated nationwide to America’s hungry population.
We have spent months at the drawing boards, developing what we believe are some of the finest shades on the market. Our wood sunglasses are crafted with bamboo, a renewable resource that grows faster than we can keep up with. It grows three feet on average every day. 
Check out the features below:
These bamboo shades are fitted with quality components including “Optics by Carl Zeiss Vision” CR-39 lenses considered the clearest lenses on the market (VIP models only or if we reach our stretch goal) or polarized CR-39 lenses. They also come equipped with a DWR (Durable water repellent) finish to ensure that they withstand every element you encounter. But we saved the best for last, each pair of bamboo sunglasses purchased directly donates 45 meals to hungry Americans!
Through working with industry experts we are also proud to launch 100% biodegradable acetate frames. Sourced from an Italian acetate manufacturer that has been in business for over a century, we are able to share with you acetate developed through an innovative new process that fuses cotton and wood fibers. This allows for superior flexibility while maintaing the frames original form through a range of temperatures.
Our brand has always been about giving back to those in need, that is why every pair of sunglasses we sell displays a unique frame stamp (located on the base of the left arm) indicating that you have directly donated 45 meals to hungry Americans.
*To comply with kickstarter's rules and regulations all proceeds from our our campaign cannot be directly donated. They will however be used to support the foundation of our company which will directly donate meals for every product sold.
Our eyewear is handcrafted start to finish, from the selection of high quality raw materials to putting the final markings on the inside of the frame. We believe in our product and we want you to be sure that you are receiving the highest quality goods available, that is why we hand test each pair to ensure that it passes our rigorous quality standards. Put simply, if we wouldn't wear them, we won't sell them.
We set out to outfit the traveler and adventurer in all of us. That is why we have put so much emphasis on producing environmentally sustainable eyewear.
We couldn't just stop at eyewear. Thats why we searched long and hard for a perfect supplier of 100% ring-spun t-shirts. Amazingly we found the perfect fit, right here in the USA. This local supplier to California apparel companies has been in business for over ten years now and we were immediately impressed by the quality of the shirts we received. 
Check out the great features below:
Our eco-friendly bamboo eyewear comes in five different models for you to choose from:
 Our 100% recycled acetate frames are being shipped in two models:

Or for our Designer T Packages, your options are endless as you can choose from any T we produce!

With the mission to be more than just another label, Balboa reflects this in each and every product.
The balboa team did not want to be a company that donates a percentage of revenues to a distant charity; instead we wanted to create a system where the customer knows exactly how they have provided help. We set up our own non-profit foundation, Meals for America, which donates money to Feeding America as well as to a collection of other grassroots solutions. Every product is then stamped with a number, identifying how many meals that customer provided to hungry Americans through these donation channels.
By being transparent we hope to change the marketplace culture and enlighten people on their power as a consumer.

As with all new companies a logo plays an integral part in the identity behind a brand. The Balboa Team knew they wanted to capture the simplicity of the world’s beauty yet they needed a symbol that could reflect their humanitarian efforts.
Today pineapple is considered a symbol of hospitality and generosity, a perfect fit for a company whose mission is to support solutions towards ending hunger in America. Not only does it serve as a worldly symbol, but pineapple is an incredibly nutritious fruit: a symbol of the healthy foods that are desperately needed in communities across the nation.
We have worked tirelessly to provide a brand that you would love. One that seeks to enjoy life, while helping others along the way. Our work, money and time have taken us to this very kickstarter.
We now need you for this journey to continue. Your generous backing will help provide us with the resources to establish an adequate inventory as well as funding to bring to life our brand, as we continue to expand our product line. We love this world and it’s people, please help us continue to pursue our mission to see everything and give something.

Risks and challenges
After coffee binges and tons of work the Balboa Production Team has finally crossed all the t's and dotted all our i's. As hard as we worked to this point the last thing we want is our opportunity to go wasted. Nevertheless here are the risks:

MANUFACTURING: No matter how much expertise and experience you have, there is always room for small error. That is why we have partnered with established manufacturers to produce both our acetate and bamboo frames. To minimize delays we have worked with our suppliers of raw materials to ensure that on our call we can begin production. We've also worked hard to pencil out lead times and establish a line of communication between our material suppliers and manufacturing firms.This ensures the smoothest transition of materials possible, but just to be safe we are leaving a little extra time as a cushion.

FULFILLMENT: Sometimes the seas get rough and things get a little crazy. Whether its a machine breaking down, a miscommunication between a supplier, or a shipment gets lost in the mail. Those things could slow down the delivery process. For all these reasons, it makes us feel that much better that we have been working for a year to establish lasting communications with our suppliers. This isn't our first rodeo and we will work tirelessly to ensure that you get exactly what you asked for. 

In any process there are always bumps in the road, it is our job to minimize these as much as possible. And you can rest assure we have been on top of the ball since day one.

Any pledge amount makes a difference! Join the Balboa family by backing our project or through helping us spread the word by sharing our page.

Cole's Fine Foods Mission is to provide the best gluten free products using the finest ingredients. We are committed to quality. Great Food. Gluten Free.
At Cole's Fine Foods, we are creating a safe environment -- free of cross contamination -- and great food that you can take home and serve to any family member, whether or not they need to eat gluten free. We've demonstrated in our six months of operation that we can deliver the variety and quality of gluten free food people want.
We are preparing to grow. Our first step is the purchase of a merchandise display freezer which will allow people to come in and pick up pizza, dinner rolls, cheesy rolls, biscuits, scones, entrees and other tasty products to heat and serve at home.
With the funds we raise through this Kickstarter campaign we also hope to buy additional shelving so we can store and display more products including an expanded line of breads and baking supplies.
Ultimately we plan to operate a completely gluten free cafe serving breakfast, lunch and dinner on site -- where people with celiac disease, gluten intolerance or other food allergies can bring their family and friends for great food that everyone will enjoy.

We are facing many of the same risks and challenges of any new small business -- creating a line of products that people want, getting the word out and building a strong customer base. campaign.story:
If you could save just one object symbolising your family history what would it be?  
For Californian DIONE CHEN (daughter of 'Free China' junk-mate, the late RENO CHEN) it was the rare old sailing junk that carried her father and five mates from Taiwan to San Francisco in 1955. 
The feature-length documentary Return of the Free China Junk follows the heart-felt journey of a daughter to pay homage to her father's memory -- and in doing so becomes a catalyst for an international effort to save the junk boat before it's turned into firewood in northern California. 
A tale of perseverance, the film explores the little known story of the world's oldest surviving wooden Chinese sailing junk of its kind, 'Free China' -- and her impossible journey home from California to Taiwan nearly sixty years later.  
Fuelled by the dreams of old and young alike from both sides of the Pacific, the legacy of the 'Free China' junk impacts not only on collective family histories -- but also on the psyche and aspirations of a nation.   
THE UNFOLDING STORY
Following her father's death in 2007, DIONE CHEN decides to visit the junk boat, abandoned in a Sacramento Delta boatyard, one last time -- and show her children who had never seen it.
“I’m not going to fall in love with that old junkie junk”, she tells UNCLE PAUL (PAUL CHOW the initiator of the junk's 1955 voyage & navigator) who warns her not to go.  
Yet, fall in love she does.  And fact rivals fiction as one challenge after another arises in finding a permanent ‘home’ for the junk and how to transport the fragile vessel. 
Octogenarian junk-mates CALVIN MEHLERT (former U.S. Vice Consul, Taipei) and PAUL CHOW also join the effort.  From the Taiwan side, the charismatic Ms. LUNG YINGTAI (historian & former Minister of Culture, Taiwan), Professor LAURENCE LWO (National Taiwan Ocean University) and legislator Dr. CHIAU WEN-YAN embrace the mission of bringing the junk "home" from USA with such enthusiasm it's infectious. 
During 2012, junk-mates LOO-CHI HU (HULOO), PAUL and CALVIN converge (from California and New Zealand, respectively) at the same port in Keelung, Taiwan where the junk first departed in 1955.  With their families from around the globe in tow, they are finally reunited with one another and the junk that impacted their lives in so many ways. Their reunion is bitter-sweet with the deeply felt absence of fellow junk-mates RENO CHEN, MARCO CHUNG and BENNY HSU. 
The vivacious DIANE SHIPWAY (whose team, including PHIL JOY, oversaw the complex design and implementation of moving the junk) reflects on the formidable process and her great delight in seeing the junk home.   
Note: film colleagues have likened the monumental efforts of transporting the junk to that of Werner Herzog's vessel in the film Fitzcarraldo!
Return of the Free China junk picks up where the prequel award-winning film The Free China Junk (2010) left off. See www.thefreechinajunkfilm.com  Both films showcase junk-mate CALVIN's stunning colour Kodachrome from the actual 1955 trans-Pacific voyage -- and a fabulous film score by JIM KIMO WEST, the lead guitarist of the Grammy award-winning "Weird Al" Yankovic (www.jimkimowest.com).  
Return of the Free China is a stand-alone film in its own right.  It celebrates the adventurous spirit of the junk-mates -- and the positive power and perseverance of the next generation and international collaborators to save a treasured piece of history for the future. 
'Free China' junk, Keelung (photo: R. Greenberg)
HOW YOU CAN HELP
Return of the Free China Junk has just received early acceptance for the New Zealand International Film Festival 2015, July/August in Auckland, Wellington & Christchurch!  The year 2015 represents the 60th anniversary of the junk's original voyage from Taiwan to San Francisco in 1955. That seems auspicious.
We screened the film as a work-in-progress to the Festival. Now we need your help in order to complete the film in time for its upcoming World Premiere.  And that's where this Kickstarter comes in!
We appreciate your assistance in any way you can help support the film's completion -- and getting the word out as widely and quickly as possible for a successful campaign.  Many thanks in anticipation!!
Toasting the junk! Oakland (photo: Raj Dhingra)
HOW IT STARTED
On the verge of burn-out after a five-year struggle to complete the prequel The Free China Junk, director/producer ROBIN GREENBERG had no inkling that a sequel film would beckon just around the corner… But as momentum started to build for saving the junk, and she was urged to document the story, how could she turn away?  
The magic of the junk seems to have woven its spell around Robin too!   
It's junk-mate LOO-CHI HU (HULOO) who first piqued Robin's interest in the amazing story of the 'Free China' junk many years ago in Christchurch, New Zealand.  Huloo was Robin's long-time T'ai Chi teacher and mentor.  Her biographical film Huloo (2008) about his remarkable life included a chapter about the 1955 voyage. This then naturally evolved into her first full-length feature documentary The Free China Junk (2010). This is why the director of the New Zealand International Film Festival is referring to this sequel film Return of the Free China Junk as the last of the "trilogy"!
With your help we will complete the film in time for its World Premiere in New Zealand during July, along with future screenings near you!
ABOUT OUR TEAM
OUR FABULOUS CAST & CREW INCLUDE…
Junk-mates:  RENO CHEN, PAUL CHOW, MARCO CHUNG, LOO-CHI HU (HULOO) & CALVIN MEHLERT (former U.S. Vice Consul, Taipei)
DIONE CHEN
LUNG YINGTAI (historian & former Minister of Culture, Taipei)
LAURENCE LWO (National Taiwan Ocean University, Keelung) 
CHIAU WEN-YAN (Legislator, Executive Yuan, Taiwan)
DIANE SHIPWAY 
HANS VAN TILBURG (NOAA Office of National Marine Sanctuaires) 
With TEH-HAN CHOW, SHIRLEY LIH-LAN HU and TONG-CHING HU
*******
Cinematography: CHEN WEN-CHI (Taiwan) & JOHN CHRISSTOFFELS (New Zealand)
Sound: CHEN DENG-HUI
Additional Camera (USA): CHRISTIAN BRUNO, CLAY WESTERVELT
Editor:  PETER METCALF, 195 Suites Ltd  
Music:  JIM KIMO WEST (www.jimkimowest.com)
Sound Mix: IAN LESLIE, Underground Sound Ltd.   (www.undergroundsound.co.nz)
Director/Producer: ROBIN GREENBERG 
*******
We could not have made it this far, to date, without the generosity and encouragement of numerous individuals in New Zealand, USA and Taiwan!
Some early sponsorship (from Taipei Economic & Cultural Office-Wellington, Rainbow Holidays, and Ministry of Culture, Taiwan) allowed us to capture events as they were unfolding in Taiwan.  Thanks to additional excellent filming by junk-mate CALVIN MEHLERT and LAURENCE LWO we had the visual bones of the stories from the California side too. 
Without our grassroots helpers in Wellington, Christchurch and Martinborough during 2014, we wouldn't have been able to take our first steps forward for editing. We're also indebted to veteran editor PETER METCALF and composer JIM KIMO WEST, who have enabled this film to nearly reach the finish line despite lack of funding.  Heart-felt thanks to you all!
Huloo & Robin, Taipei (photo: Tong-Ching Hu)
*SPECIAL NOTE*
Before this film could be completed, very sadly, junk-mate LOO-CHI HU (HULOO), passed away in Christchurch, New Zealand, late 2013.  It was Huloo who first introduced Robin to the legend of the 'Free China' junk. This film will be dedicated to his memory.  
The film also pays tribute to the passing of DIANE SHIPWAY and JOE SPOTTS -- along with junk-mates RENO CHEN, MARCO CHUNG & BENNY HSU…   
The spirit of the 'Free China' junk stories and its inspiring characters will live on with your support, thank you!!!  
Free China junk 1955 (image: Calvin Mehlert)

Risks and challenges
Challenges? Bring them on! 

We've faced challenge after challenge over a four-year period to shepherd this project from an improbable idea through filming to near-completion. It's been a labor-of-love documentary throughout. 

'Return of the Free China Junk' unexpectedly grew out of Robin's prequel 'The Free China Junk' (2010), which blossomed from her film 'Huloo' (2008) which took five years to complete... So we're not exaggerating to say this film represents the culmination of a twelve year passion (obsession?) to research and document the fantastic stories surrounding the 'Free China' junk!

The perseverance it took to find a way to save the rare junk and transport it safely to its new home mirrors the dedication of our awesome team to bring this film to fruition to the highest quality with all too few financial resources. 

It's thanks to the incredible grass-roots efforts of friends across New Zealand last year, with fundraising events in Christchurch and Martinborough, that enabled us to make a start with editing. 

Now we truly need your assistance to complete the final stage of editing, music, color-grading and sound-mix!

Please help support this film to whatever degree you can, and you too will become part of the journey to bring this inspirational story to life!

And IF we're fortunate enough to exceed our target, then any additional funding will be prioritised toward getting the film seen as widely as possible, namely:

The video above is a little insight into Falling Star, followed by a slide show of Bryan and I before he passed away.
A Little Bit About My Project
Do you see that girl below you in that picture? That is me, six years ago when I was 17 years old. Do you see that boy beside me? His name was Bryan, he was my best friend. WAS being the keyword, I loved him, but he could only see his own pain. I lost Bryan two months after this photo was taken, and this book explores the ways that suicide and depression affects everyone involved. 
I am raising funds to traditionally publish my first novel, Falling Star. Query letters and good writing just isn't enough in a world where publishing companies rarely take risks on young and emerging new authors with no platform or background. They need solid evidence that your book will sell, which I will have when I raise the funds needed.
I plan on using the funds raised to promote my novel, and to create a platform and fan base for Falling Star. I will use the funds to hire an artist to create the cover for my book (convert it to eBook format, as well as paperback), hire promotional agencies that will help to circulate the book to a larger audience, and to market the final product.
This heartfelt novel is a way for me to bring awareness to depression and suicide in teenagers, as well as giving the main character, Ella, chances and choices that I never had... This fictional novel is based upon true events, events that shaped the person I am today and changed my life. 
Falling Star
A young adult novel
Falling Star is about a teenage girl, named Ella. She is from a small town where nothing new ever happens, and things rarely change. Her little world revolves around her best friend, Byron. He is the star of the school, until his path begins to darken. He begins distancing himself from Ella, while she tries to ignore his changing personality. Soon, Ella discovers that Byron has become depressed, but is it too late to save him? Or herself?
Please feel free to like my page for Falling Star on Facebook so that I can continue to grow my fan base. Facebook.com/FallingStar2015. 
Chapter One SNEAK PEAK
 Sometimes, life can be hard. That seems to be the general consensus anyways. Life is not always picking flowers, carefree worries, and sappy love stories. Life is sometimes hard; it can be tragic; and it can be confusing. But, through all that, isn't it worth it? This crazy thing called life?
I suppose I should start this off, by telling you that my name is Ella Cane. The majority of my friends call me El, or Ellie. That seems to be the norm nowadays, shortening names that are already rather short. It seems a bit silly to me, but I don't really mind. I suppose I tried to get them to stop, they wouldn't anyway. It just seems to slip from their tongues.  
 Lets see, I am, I guess, what is considered a "normal" teenager. I have that shaggy brown hair that looks similar to mud, but my mother is always trying to tell me that "is as golden as the sun." I decided to cut it all off last year. I think it broke her heart a little bit- I did feel quite badly for that. I am 18 years old now though, she should understand that I need to do things for me. It is my senior year of high school, who hasn't done something a bit crazy? But I digress; I also have mud brown eyes (still normally referred to as "golden") that matches my hair. I am average height, and average build. I play sports, and I get good grades. I am friends with most everyone, and I do what is expected of me most of the time. I know you must be thinking how average I seem and you are right. In the craziness that is the world today I am pretty average. But, here in this little town where I live, I am an original; a one of a kind.
Everyone knows my name, my family, my history. This little farm town in nowhere Michigan is the only place that I have ever known, the place I call home. Nothing new happens, and life goes on just fine. I can't wait to get out of this place as soon as I graduate. I am not sure where to yet. But as many things that I love about this town, I can't stay here.  
How else should I start this, oh, perhaps the most important thing about my story, is, that it is not about me at all. I mean, I am aware that I am quite an intriguing individual, but no, this story is about my best friend. His name is Byron Rood. He is the boy that my life revolves around. In this little town, he gives me hope, and he makes me believe that anything is possible.  
Byron is the boy that was never meant to be here in the first place, he is like an oddity put here by mistake. In a place full of normality, he radiates eccentricity. Take his looks for example. His hair is the black that shines so bright it seems almost blue. He grows it long, and every girl gazes in his direction as he walks past. His eyes are the darkest brown you've ever seen. Their hint of sparkle like pieces of Smoky Quartz. He is beautiful, almost ethereal.  
Now, you may thinking, he must be conceited, a beauty like this. But, that is another thing about him- he is humble and kind. He is that person who excels at everything he ever attempts. The kind of person most people can't help but like, as much as they want to hate him. For example, I have been competing with him for valedictorian since we hit freshman year. He seems to have a much easier time achieving A's than I do; a natural intelligence It infuriates me! But how can you hate someone who will stop at the drop of a hat to help you out, no questions asked, just because that same someone kicked your ass on the last Calculus test?  
Yes, this is a story about a boy who was dumped on this earth, full of the life in a way that some of us never find. "Just another story about a boy?" you might ask. But this is not just a story about any boy. This tale is of my boy.
Want to read the rest of chapter one? Check out my blog listed below! Still not sure about it? Check out my short stories on there as well to give you a better idea of my writing and hopefully win you over!
http://hbmusicreuter.blogspot.com/2015/02/edited-and-revised-chapter-one-of.html
 A Little Glimpse Into My Life
My name is Hannah Reuter, and I am 23 years old. I am just your average middle-class citizen working for my dreams to come true!
I am from a small little village in Michigan, with only about 1200 people TOTAL, farm animals outnumbered us! I have associate degree in communications and am currently pursuing my bachelor degree in business from Western Michigan University. 
Right now I am living in St. Louis, Missouri, but I love traveling. In the last two years I have lived in Michigan, Alaska, Colorado, and Missouri. I work in National Parks and restaurants in the surrounding areas. I LOVE seeing the world and meeting new people, the different cultures just within the USA is amazing.
Hobbies of mine? I love music, playing guitar and singing is my way to relax after a long day of work and school. I also love to read and write, this will be my first novel, with many more to come! 
This novel is based upon my Senior year of high school when my friend, Bryan committed suicide, although the book itself gives the characters many more choices than I ever had. Having my best friend commit suicide changed my life, and made me realize that life is very fragile, so we may as well live it to the fullest. 
I hope that this book will bring awareness to teen depression and suicide, because it happens much more often than you would think.
Have any more questions? Ask away!

The app will open up a network of people ready to work for you.  The map will display the nearest available workers to you. When you tap on a worker he will received your request and accept or reject your job. After the job is accepted, you can see your worker(s) approaching the work site. Think of this app like "road side assistance" for jobs around the house and office. The workers are pre-qualified to assure their ability to perform the job. Plus, no cash is necessary because all transactions are handle completely online (including the tip).

A Deck of GOOD DEED CHALLENGES for kids (and adults too). The cards will teach them to be kind to others, animals, the earth and themselves. Kindness is contagious, and each time they complete a good deed challenge, they will inspire others to pay it forward, which will make the world a better place!
We see it all too often these days; on the internet, TV, in the newspapers and even on the streets. There is A LOT of negativity in the world. Kids being bullied (some, even to the point of suicide), racism, hate based on sexual orientation, violence, depression, vandalism, ignoring social issues in our cities and sadly, the list goes on and on.
We're fed up with it all! It's time for change! And that's why we decided to create this deck of good deeds. We want kids to learn how to be kind to others while they're young, and carry those lessons with them for life! Will this deck solve every problem there is? No, but it's a damn good start!  We can make a difference. We need to act together, and grow together as a community, or this is all just a waste of time.
"My Deck of Good Deeds" contains 56 cards (53 Good Deed challenge cards and 3 Award cards). The good deed challenge cards range in difficulty, from easy to more challenging (requiring more time to complete, creativity and/or help from a friend or parent).
Receive award cards for your progress. 3 to earn in the deck.
Not final box, or card back design.
Deedtags has been in the making for about 5 years now. We're very happy with the progress we've made so far, but we know we can grow even faster and make an even bigger impact if we create fresh ideas that engage people of all ages. The smartphone app and book of 100 good deeds are fun and accessible for teens and adults. For kids, we feel the deck of good deeds would be a fun way for them to learn about kindness.
We're using Kickstarter as our platform, because it allows us to introduce Deedtags to a global audience. Issues like bullying, racism, hate based on sexual orientation and much more, are global in nature. We're all affected by them. By supporting our cause, you're showing that as a community, we care about kindness and won't just accept the horrible things we see happening every day.
We've used all the funds we have to pay for the smartphone app, merchandise, promotional material and book of 100 deeds. We're printing these good deed decks through USPCC (The United States Playing Card Company) and their minimum order is 2500 decks. That will drive the cost per unit down, yes, but it's still going to cost quite a few bucks to order even just the minimum! And that's why we need your help!!!
Thank you (Your name here) ________________ in advance!!! :D

Details on the wristbands, pins, shirts and book.

The BulletSafe Bulletproof Baseball Cap offers ballistic protection with a friendly, professional appearance. 
Why? People in dangerous jobs need protection, and dangerous situations need less aggression. The BulletSafe Bulletproof Baseball Cap offers discreet protection while looking professional and approachable. It's a great way for people to stay safe.
A Prototype of the BulletSafe Bulletproof Baseball Cap
The BulletSafe Bulletproof Baseball Cap is comfortable, lightweight, easy to wear, and offers the same frontal protection area as a ballistic helmet. 
From Prototype to Production
Shown (from left): A polymer mock-up of the panel; a paper pattern; and a shooting sample made from a helmet section.  Turning these items into production parts costs lots of money. Making parts strong enough to stop a bullet requires high-temperature/high-pressure tooling. It is expensive. With your help we can overcome this cost and offer this hat for far less than a ballistic helmet.  
Features
We start with the finest baseball cap we can find. A Flexfit, Twill, Six-Panel hat in one of three sizes. We modify it to include the BulletSafe ballistic panel. The result is a handsome look with great protection. The hat will come in three sizes: Small, Medium/Large, and XL/2X.   
Successful Test Prototype
Our test prototypes stopped rounds up to NIJ Level IIA.  We expect to offer protection of NIJ level IIA with our production hat. If so, the hat will stop .40, 9mm and .38 caliber rounds.
More Information About Our Project's History:This project began in January of 2014.  The initial spark occurred at a trade show when I was repeatedly asked if we made ballistic helmets.  I thought "yuck! I don't want to make those, they look ridiculous in a civilian environment." But ignoring a number of customers is always a bad idea.  I decided to develop something different.  
We built our first prototype in March of 2014.  We molded clay off of a mannequin head and tried it in a baseball cap.  It wasn't perfect, but there was something there.  Further prototypes continued as I worked on the fit and size of the panel through the summer. 
September, 2014 - I hired a patent attorney to do a patent search and was surprised to see that no patents existed on a bulletproof baseball cap. I was clear to invent ours.
October - I began wear-testing mock ballistic panels to see if they would be comfortable enough to wear every day.  They did well.  The panel was light enough and baseball caps have enough space in them that they were unobtrusive.  Here is a picture of me at a live pumpkin carving performance wearing one.  Spiderman approves.
November 2014 - Once we got the shape right, we made a shootable prototype.  That test is shown in this video. The sounds quality is a little rough due to the ventilation system in the range and I stumble on the words a bit, but it worked!  
BulletSafe Bulletproof Baseball Cap - Prototype Test Video
PLAY

In late November I was ready to get tooling estimates for the production tooling.  The best estimate was $19,000.  It was too much.  I thought the project was done.  
That evening my wife told me not to give up on the bulletproof hat.   Our sales representative Jennifer (who's voice can be heard in the shooting video) said that she thought customers would buy it.  I guess deep down inside I had believed as well, I had already chosen the cover photo of our 2015 catalog and on it I am wearing one.  
We decided that Kickstarter might save the project.  Your pledges to buy could provide some of the capital required to start the project and your votes would demonstrate support.  A successful Kickstarter would also show our existing retailers that people want these hats.  
Why Is Our Goal So Low?
We decided to set the goal at $3,500.  It is a small amount compared to the tooling cost, but it is a Kickstart for the project.  $3,500 is enough to get us to put the weight of our company behind it. It is the minimum amount we need to promise with 100% certainty that we will deliver your merchandise.    
Project Delivery Timeline:
January 2015 - Kickstarter Project Duration 
January 2015 - ANME and SHOT Tradeshows - We will be showing the prototypes and accepting pre-orders
February 2015 - Tooling ordered, Non-bulletproof caps shipped
April 2015 - First prototypes from production-level tools 
May 2015 - Ballistics testing at Oregon Ballistic Laboratories (OBL)
June 2015 - Possible material adjustments based upon May testing
August 2015 - Second round of ballistic testing at OBL
September 2015 - Production panels produced
October 2015 - Cap production begins, Rewards start shipping
November 2015 - All rewards shipped.
