Three best friends are on a mission for greatness: to open the first biscuit sandwich, platter, and spreads shoppe in DC! With your help and support, Ayeshah, Mo, and Jason can design, build, and operate the region's best biscuit shoppe.
Meet the Mason Dixie Family!
Our Chefs
Jason is our secret weapon... Ok, maybe not so secret (http://dc.eater.com/tags/jason-gehring). He is a Rammy-nominated Pastry Chef of the Year (http://www.ramw.org/news/2014-rammy-awards-finalists-announced) who has excelled in the DC culinary scene for years. As opening Chef for Astro Doughnuts & Fried Chicken, he brings a wealth of experience in pastry+savory and fresh casual restaurant operations. You can find him covered in tattoos and flour on any given day.
Meet Mo - also known as "our super taster". He has one heckuva palette that has shaped our creative flavor pairings stemming from his years of experience as a chef and sommelier (http://brightestyoungthings.com/articles/affordable-quality-bubbly-dc-sommeliers-weigh-in.htm, http://capitolfile-magazine.com/dining/articles/washingtons-top-wine-lists). Ask him about pairing wine with anything - he always has the best suggestions!
What is Mason Dixie Biscuit Co.?
This.
Stuff like this.
This.
And this.
 Which all leads to this:
Yum.
We at Mason Dixie believe that a picture is worth a thousand words - so we hope these photos give you a good idea of what we are working with! Our biscuit shoppe will feature anything from our signature chicken biscuit sandwich, to our Benton's bacon fried egg and cheese biscuit, to seasonal specials, like our lobster Newburg biscuit bowl and rosemary biscuit with grilled figs, goat cheese and honey.
We will also feature biscuit platters: two biscuits with your choice of sausage gravy, "chicken pot pie" gravy, or chocolate "gravy." For those interested in a quick to-go snack, you can try one of our biscuit and spread combos: get two biscuits with your choice of a "butter" and artisanal jam. Try our "cracklin" butter with orange marmalade or our bacon jam with apple butter.
How Your Contribution Will Benefit YOU
Your support allows us to bring these amazing, delicious, home-style, affordable, slow on the go, biscuits to the DC market that is void of a biscuit shop, period. A Mason Dixie meal brings the neighborhood together by providing a wholesome, home-cooked, Southern comfort food option to a community hungry for food that is familiar, affordable, portable, and downright tasty! No more franchisey chicken and cow gimmicks, nothing that is made with pink slime - instead, we are bringing a bit of nostalgia that reminds us of how iconic Southern cuisine is to our American way of life.
How Your Contribution Can Change Our Lives
Mason Dixie isn't a project - it's our future.  All of us have dreamed of owning our own restaurant for years - and we have finally found the right concept, the right time, the right community, and now the right venue to get the word out and hopefully get much-needed funding to open. Your contributions will allow us to pay for our 4-month pop-up residency at EatsPlace in Parkview! It will help us obtain our pop-up restaurant, basic equipment (fryer cart), and retail supplies (bags, utensils, etc.).
Our Goal: Bring Back Affordable Slow Food!
In today’s economy, the average American has to eat on the run or at their desk and does not always have time to enjoy a sit-down meal. We also understand that it is hard to “earn a buck,” and spend it on the right food! That is why it is important to us that we provide cost-conscious food without forgoing flavor, farm-fresh ingredients, or culinary creativity. Mason Dixie believes in serving the working American a home-cooked meal in a quick and casual setting. Biscuits are iconic staples of a family meal – they are passed around a table, a treat to which everyone looks forward. We want our food options to offer that touch of home and to trigger a sense of calm and the slow-pace of a family dinner, even on the go. Our goal is to become a neighborhood staple - a go-to for modern comfort food served with a side of Southern hospitality.
Some of Our Fun Rewards
NEW! For Baby Biscuit Fans
Baby Onesie (Up to 24 mo)
Men's Tee - Women's Fitted Tee Also Available
Sponsored Apron & To-Go Bags
Insulated Tote & Mason "Dixie" Jar
Shout Outs!
We realize that we owe a lot of what we have today to the talents and generosity of our dear friends who have spent countless hours, dollars, and sleepless nights to help us get to this point. We owe our amazing food photography and videography to our dear friend Kurt Powers - check him out on http://www.spacedivisionphoto.com. We also bow down to the talented storyteller/director of our video - Joe Kuehne (https://www.facebook.com/joe.kuehne) - for bringing out the best in us, our product, and now our future.
And for supporting us during events, promotions, and tough times....deep breath...Matthew Steinhelfer, Emily  Carroll, Matt Giragosian, Byron Hughey, Josh Bailey, Theo Rutherford, Felix Asprer, Javier Aquino, Kevin Parton, Marjorie Meek-Bradley, Holly Barzyk, Briggs Bralliar, and Jorge Leite. You have ALL made a direct impact on our lives in the best way - and we are forever grateful. We love you dearly. Thank you.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We feel very lucky. Restaurants are a risky business and many fail due to poor planning - but we have taken our time, really thought things through, and come up with a product and concept that people are already raving about. (NOTE: We got over 400 likes on Facebook in less than 48 hours - WITHOUT PR/Advertising and BEFORE people even tasted our biscuits!! Our fans ROCK!!) 

Because of this demand, we have been approached by multiple entities - from realtors who want a brick and mortar, to food truck manufacturers, to franchisers - all of which greatly impact the business model we have been planning and budgeting for by increasing our cost to entry. 

This Kickstarter funding will help us open a pop-up, but when our biscuits pass the taste test, there is a risk that demand will exceed capacity and we will need to ramp up quickly with a more permanent solution, which will involve more cash. 

That is why we are sticking to our plan and proceeding with a pop-up. It will prove we have a viable product that is backed by demand, validate our choice in location, and help us tweak our operations model for a successful larger scale endeavor. The pop-up gives us the leverage we need to show a bank that we have a proven proof-of-concept and that we deserve a loan for a permanent shoppe.

Your contributions and help will have a more profound impact in shaping our destiny than you think. Every dollar gets us closer to our dream of operating the region's most successful biscuit shoppe - and when we get there, we'll be sure to save a seat for you.

Thank you.

campaign.story:
Redwood Trails Beef Jerky is an artisan beef jerky company that prides itself in being the first to use wine in its marinate. This evolutionary concept that is attracting people back to jerky, as a part of their healthy diet, comes naturally from the influences and abundance of the Northern California Wine Country in which we reside. The high quality of our product comes from a superior grade of protein and natural ingredients. There are no preservatives, no nitrates, and we have removed up to two-thirds of sodium as compared to the leading brands. Redwood Trails Beef Jerky has exchanged salt for its unique added flavor profiles.
Artisan hand carved beef – I crosscut the grain to create a more tender bite of meat.
Our jerky represents a marriage of old world technique with a twenty-first century understanding of healthy curing and proper handling of our meat. We have set a higher standard in the beef jerky industry. First, by the quality of our meat in using USDA Choice Top Round of Beef. Secondly, we hand carve all our meat, cutting against the grain to create a tenderness in each piece not matched by others. Thirdly, the beef is marinated for a week in the freshest of ingredients and wines from Sonoma and Napa Valley to impart each piece with an intense delicate flavor. Next, comes a slow smoke over real hickory wood to infuse a flavor that just cannot be duplicated with those artificially created “Natural Smoke Flavoring” used by the “Big Guys”.
Unique flavor – I cut down the salt and replaced with flavor.
The moment you rip open the bag, smell the tempting hickory bouquet as it embraces all your senses, and up until you have finished the last tender bite of jerky, you will understand why we take the time to prepare everything in a certain way without cutting corners.
All natural, no preservatives.
The concept of marinating with wine is very unique and it naturally compliments the pairing of beef jerky with wine without the palette burn of excessive salt. Just think of the possible wine variations you can enjoy with the following choices.
Real wood smoked – most companies use smoke flavoring.
Argentinian Chimichurri - Includes Cabernet Sauvignon wine, assorted chilies, fresh cilantro and garlic creating a down-to-earth flavor with a hint of heat.
Chinese Five-Spice- This is not some cheap imitation of a worn-out over used Asian anecdote of Teriyaki. We start with the finest imported plum sauce, add sesame oil and a hint of quintessential of Peking cooking, Chinese five spice. With the addition of Pinot Noir wine we have created a taste that would make the Emperors of the Yuan Dynasty proud.
Hearty Red Wine Steak Sauce - Is the embodiment of our archetype, three classic blend of red wines combined into a traditional steak sauce. The perfect combination of meat and red wine. If you will only experiment with one of our flavors this is the one!
Cuban Mojo - Our Caribbean inspired creation blends fresh citrus juices with Gewürztraminer wine, jalapenos, fresh cilantro and mint to bring out a warm sunny essence.
Cranberry Barbeque Sauce - This starts with the spicy complexity of the vigorous Zinfandel grape and builds it up with the astringently sweet cranberry to create a wonderfully multifaceted barbeque sauce that screams to be slowly cooked over hard wood.
If you enjoy the salty, shoe leathery stuff that gives jerky its original name, then we are not that jerky! However, if a tender, savory and flavorful piece of meat appeals to you? Then we have the product for you. Redwood Trails Beef Jerky is a healthy protein for your active lifestyle. It is so addictive to your pallet that you will have a hard time putting it down, especially once the package is open.  
As the Owner/Chef, I have over 30 years of experience as a professional chef in leading hotel chains. My contribution to help others and pay it forward, has already accumulated to over 500 hours in volunteer time to our local school districts. I have cooked for the community, school celebration events, and athletic programs. My goal is to continue to support and give 10% of the company profit back to local schools for culinary purposes and athletic programs.  
Thank you for your support and please enjoy this delicacy!
Karl V. Turner III
Owner/Chef
Redwood Trails Beef Jerky™
Culinary Company
For more details, please read through the Rewards on the right →
 * Non-alcoholic wines are offered as rewards as a result of Kickstarter's backer reward policy.

campaign.story:
WE'RE AT OUR GOAL! NOW GOING FOR FUNDS FOR ADDITIONAL MARKETING AND PRACTICAL WORKBOOK ON "EDUCATION OF THE HEART" FOR KIDS THROUGH ADULTS!
The project is designed to showcase the incredibly bold attempt of Bhutan to create a culture of happiness, yet in a provocative way. Through the main character, questions ranging from "how does one achieve personal happiness?" to "can cultures be really transformed?" to "how can spirituality be balanced with materialism?" are posed. All of this is done with the beautiful backdrop of Bhutan, the exotic monasteries, and colorful festivals playing an important role. The main character discovers that all true transformations begin with an education and opening of the heart.
The funding would provide the monies needed to publish the book and most importantly market the book through clearly thought out social and traditional marketing strategies. So many books on the market these days do not make an impact because the marketing strategy and funding for success of self-published books is underestimated. 
Once the initial goal is met, additional pledges will be used for the design, development, and editing of "A Curriculum of the Heart," for all ages, which will have current research, practical ideas, and immediate applications to begin to transform ourselves and the culture wherever we are.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
December has been selected as the date of completion as lag time for publishing has been factored in. The biggest risk is really the lack of marketing or a clearly articulated marketing strategy, which I have been discussing for months with social and traditional marketers.
